title: Marryatville: Muck up day leads to graduation bans
text:
A number of Year 12 students from Marryatville High School are facing bans from graduating after their muck-up day antics.

The director of education in the eastern suburbs Greg Petherick said 16 students broke into the school in the early hours of Friday morning and wreaked havoc.

Mr Petherick said staff found bins overturned, lockers emptied, toilet paper thrown across the place, duct tape on walls and even spray paint on the cricket pitch.

It is reported two students burned tables and glued doors shut.

"Not a good sight at all, very disruptive, very intentional and as a result, the school has taken decisive action," he told ABC Radio Adelaide.

He also said police have been involved, as it was treated as a criminal act. The school, however, has chosen not to pursue legal action, but instead banned the students from graduating.

There is now a petition to overturn the decision and allow the students to graduate from Year 12.
description: Nearly 20 eastern suburbs high school students are facing bans from graduating after they allegedly vandalised the school in the early hours of Friday morning.
